NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Construction work for multi-dwelling buildings and individual houses
Architectural, construction, engineering and inspection services

TITLE.P: Procurement of 6 Frameworks to deliver development and related services

SHORT_DESCR.P: WCHT invited expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced providers to deliver works and services under 6 Frameworks comprising:

Procurement of a framework to deliver individual development projects of a value up to GBP 0-4 000 000. The framework is awarded to 6 providers. Works will be called-off either through mini-competition or direct selection. The current development pipeline is provided in Appendix 28 of the ITT.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Watford Community Housing reserved the right to award works that fall between the value of the Lots 1 and 2 (i.e. GBP 4 000 000 and GBP 3 000 000) based on the capacity and workload within each Lot.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Procurement of a framework to deliver development projects worth a value of GBP 3 000 000+. The framework is awarded to 6 providers. Works will be called-off either through mini-competition or direct selection.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Watford Community Housing reserved the right to award works that fall between the value of the Lots 1 and 2 (i.e. GBP 4 000 000 and GBP 3 000 000) based on the capacity and workload within each Lot.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Procurement of a framework for the provision of employer's Agent services. The framework is awarded to 5 providers. Services will be called off either through mini-competition or direct selection. The current development pipeline is provided in Appendix 28 of the ITT.

Procurement of a framework for the provision of architect services. The framework is awarded to 5 providers. Services will be called off either through mini-competition or direct selection.The current development pipeline is provided in Appendix 28 of the ITT.

Procurement of a Framework for the provision of principal Designer services. The framework is awarded to 3 providers. Services will be called-off either through mini-competition or direct selection. The current development pipeline is provided in Appendix 28 of the ITT.

TITLE.P: Lot 6 — Transport and Highways Planning Consultant

SHORT_DESCR.P: Procurement of a framework for the provision of transport and Highways Planning Consultancy Services. The framework is awarded to 1 provider and as such all services will be awarded by direct selection. The current development pipeline is provided in Appendix 28 of the ITT.

ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR.ADDRESS: Teresa Gavin House, Woodford Avenue, Woodford Gree
Studio 3 Blue Lion Place Long Lane
West House, Meltham Road, Honley, Holmfirth, West
The Old School, Exton Street, The Old School

TITLE.P: Lot 6 — Transport and Highways Planning Consultant

INFO_ADD.P: The following organisations will be able to “call-off” contracts under the framework agreement:
(ii) any entity within the same group of companies as the Trust from time to time;
(iii) any entity or joint venture company that the Trust or any other member of its group holds an interest in from time to time;

(iv) other Social Housing Providers in the UK (both those that are in existence now and those that may be in existence in the future) and any members of their supply chain including direct labour organisations and suppliers. “Social Housing Provider” for this purpose means any provider of social housing and includes, without limitation, registered housing providers, local authorities and ALMOs. A list of the current Social Housing Providers can be found by visiting: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/current-registered-providers-of-social-housing
(v) National, Regional and Local Health Authorities in the UK including NHS Trusts, and any organisation providing a service to these bodies;

(vi) Local and Regional Authorities in the UK (including any arms length organisations or service providers working on their behalf) delivering any public or private sector construction related projects including housing, education, highways and infrastructure work; and
(vii) service providers delivering services to any other Government Agency in the UK including the Ministry of Defence and Highways Agency.
It should be noted that none of the organisations referred to in Paragraphs (i) to (vii) above shall be under any obligation to use the framework agreement.

It should be noted that the estimated Lot values set out in this Notice are an estimate only, and may increase depending on the number of organisations that decide to use and call-off contracts under the framework agreement during its term.

The Trust reserved the right to cancel the procurement and not to proceed with all or part of the framework agreement at any stage of the procurement process. The Trust shall not in any circumstances reimburse any expense incurred by bidders in preparing their SQ or tender submissions for the framework agreement.

It should be noted that the estimated Lot values set out in this Notice are an estimate only and are based on Watford Community Housing Trust’s anticipated requirements. These values may increase depending on the number of other organisations that decide to use and call-off contracts under the framework agreement during its term.

ADDRESS_REVIEW_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: High Court of England and Wales

REVIEW_PROCEDURE.P: In accordance with Regulation 55, 87 and Chapter 6 of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.
